articles.author: Elizabeth Rayne
articles.title: Scientists Found Footprints That Push Humanity’s Timeline Back By 40 Million Years - Yahoo
articles.description: Fossilized tracks in Australia reveal amniotes evolved 35-40 million years earlier than thought, pushing tetrapod origins back to the Devonian period.
articles.content:
Heres what youll learn when you read this story:
  • The common ancestor of all tetrapods (including humans) was previously thought to have emerged at the dawn of the Carboniferous period.
